page.title: 07RELIGION
page.content:
Sunday School is organised by the Rector's wife. It meets twice every three weeks at the rectory. Each year the children have an outing to the river Ure at Burton House in Masham.
The children of the Sunday School sometimes join with the children of the School in presenting a religious production in the Church, especially at Christmas.
Harvest Festival has a special meaning among the farming community and because of this the Harvest Festival service has a very high attendance. Latecomers often find nowhere to sit.
The schoolchildren have a special 'Leavers Service'at the end of the summer term just before the eleven-year-olds go to Bedale School.
